thread.title: Rio Tinto maintains dividend as earnings beat estimates
thread.title_full: Rio Tinto maintains dividend as earnings beat estimates

title: Rio Tinto maintains dividend as earnings beat estimates
text:
Rio Tinto has revealed its half year profit and dividends.
Rio Tinto has maintained its policy of paying out half of the previous year's dividend in August, despite a sharp slump in commodity prices and underlying profits to $US2.9 billion.
Shareholders will be paid $US1.075 per share , which is exactly half the $US2.15 full year dividend paid for the 2014 calendar year.
The miner paid an interim dividend of $US0.96 in August 2014, and the company has continued to increase shareholder returns while revenues slide.
Rio's half year underlying earnings were $US5.1 billion in 2014, and Thursday's result in the weakest since the $US2.6 billion result in 2010.
Advertisement The miner has been slashing capital spending to support its profits in recent years.
Rio's Australian shares had risen for the second successive day prior to the results being released on Thursday afternoon.
The stock was fetching $53.21 per share shortly before the results were released.
Rio shares often rise in the weeks before Rio pays its dividend.
The iron ore price has also been strong in recent days and was fetching $US56.78 per tonne on Thursday.
More to come...
